title: Bel decomposition
summary: In semi-Riemannian geometry, the Bel decomposition, taken with respect to a specific timelike congruence, is a way of breaking up the Riemann tensor of a pseudo-Riemannian manifold into lower order tensors with properties similar to the electric field and magnetic field.  Such a decomposition was partially described by Alphonse Matte in 1953[1] and by Lluis Bel in 1958.[2]
